title: Strategies for Utilizing Visual Cue Effects in Anatomical Visualization Learning

context.prior_knowledge: Knowledge of basic anatomy and comprehension of medical terminology
context.additional_context: Development of an anatomy module within a language pathology-linked training program for current practitioners

learning_goals: Learners can utilize real-world-based visual cues to identify core elements of anatomical structures with 80% accuracy.
Learners can reduce cognitive load required to explain complex anatomical relationships by 20% through visual cues.
Learners can improve long-term memory test scores by over 15% using visualization materials that include selective real-world representations.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
